Package com.idevicesinc.sweetblue

Class AddServiceListener.ServiceAddEvent

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.idevicesinc.sweetblue.utils.Event
      • com.idevicesinc.sweetblue.AddServiceListener.ServiceAddEvent
  • Enclosing interface:
    AddServiceListener
    public static class AddServiceListener.ServiceAddEvent
extends Event
    Event struct passed to AddServiceListener.onEvent(ServiceAddEvent) to give you information about the success of a service addition or the reason(s) for its failure.

      • solicited

        public final boolean solicited()
        This returns true if this event was the result of an explicit call through SweetBlue, e.g. through BleServer.addService(BleService, AddServiceListener). It will return false otherwise, which can happen if for example you use BleServer.getNativeLayer() to bypass SweetBlue for whatever reason. Another theoretical case is if you make an explicit call through SweetBlue, then you get AddServiceListener.Status.TIMED_OUT, but then the native stack eventually *does* come back with something - this has never been observed, but it is possible.

      • wasSuccess

        public final boolean wasSuccess()
        Convenience forwarding of AddServiceListener.Status.wasSuccess().

      • toString

        public final String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
